thread.title: Injured Chelsea skipper John Terry sits in away end with Blues fans for draw with Burnley
thread.title_full: Injured Chelsea skipper John Terry sits in away end with Blues fans for draw with Burnley

author: Liam Corless
title: Injured Chelsea skipper John Terry sits in away end with Blues fans for draw with Burnley
text:
Sport Injured Chelsea skipper John Terry sits in away end with Blues fans for draw with Burnley Injury ruled Terry out of the clash with the Clarets so he opted instead to watch the game alongside Chelsea's fans Share John Terry sat in the away end at Turf Moor after injury ruled him out of Chelsea's game against Burnley (Photo: PA) Share Get Chelsea FC   
John Terry didn't let a gruesome ankle injury keep him away from Turf Moor as he sat with Chelsea's fans to watch their draw with Burnley. 
The Blues skipper was photographed in the away end by eagle-eyed supporters who were all too happy to enjoy the game alongside a club legend. 
Terry picked up an injury in training in midweek which left him needing stitches and ruled him out of the clash with the Clarets. 
The 36-year-old centre-back watched on in Lancashire as Chelsea were forced to settle for a point. Read More
